title: Value-Add Acquisition Strategy
summary: A strategic approach to acquiring underperforming multifamily properties with operational inefficiencies or physical deficiencies that can be improved to increase NOI and property value through targeted interventions.
key_points: Target properties with below-market rents due to poor management or deferred maintenance
Look for operational inefficiencies like high expenses or poor tenant screening
Identify cosmetic improvements with high ROI (unit renovations, common areas, curb appeal)
Calculate renovation costs precisely with contractor bids, not estimates
Verify rent premiums for renovated units by comparing to actual market comps
Structure purchase with contingency periods for thorough due diligence
Negotiate seller financing or earnest money terms that protect your capital
examples: Acquiring a 50-unit property with dated interiors where $5,000 per unit renovation yields $150 monthly rent premium
Taking over a mismanaged property with 15% vacancy and reducing it to market rate of 5%
Converting unused storage space to additional rental units to increase gross potential income
